intro: Plectranthus pekinensis, commonly known as the Chinese mint or Peking mint, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It is characterized by its aromatic, slightly minty leaves that are often used in traditional Chinese medicine and culinary applications. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or pink, which bloom in the summer months. Plectranthus pekinensis thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight.
